Academics Home / Explore Programs / Journalism and Professional Writing

Journalism and Professional Writing

Degree

Bachelor of Arts

School

Arts and Communication

Department

Communication, Journalism, and Film

Program at a Glance

Put your passion for words into practice by studying journalism and professional writing at TCNJ. Our cross-disciplinary program focuses on audio, video, photo, and visual storytelling to prepare students for opportunities in multimedia news, digital magazines, broadcast journalism, and professional communications. You’ll learn to write with power, skill, and insight under the guidance of accomplished faculty. Professional value and expertise as a multiplatform journalist can be further developed by opportunities with our award-winning campus media.

ApplyRequest Info

Minors

Broadcast and Multimedia Journalism Minor

Journalism Minor

Professional Writing Minor

Students benefit from:

  • Dynamic, engaging classes in a culture of collaboration and support
  • A flexible curriculum with opportunities to pursue second majors or minors in: communication studies, interactive multimedia, English, history, international studies, psychology, or marketing
  • Experiential learning through community-based research projects and internships
  • Professional growth at award-winning student news organizations and publications
  • First-rate instruction and strong mentorship from dedicated, experienced faculty
  • Strong alumni network connections for internships and employment

Careers

Our program prepares students for a variety of internships and careers that entail researching, writing, and editing news, features, magazine articles, newsletters, and technical or business documents in print and digital formats. 

Recent graduates have been successfully employed locally and nationally as journalists, public relations or communication professionals, social media professionals, trade publication editors, and television production assistants.

Experiential Learning

Journalism and professional writing students develop skills and cultivate professional connections through faculty mentors who are experienced writers. Students also intern in various fields and have the chance to write for on-campus media organizations, including TCNJ’s award-winning, student-produced newspaper, The Signal, and Her Campus TCNJ, a branch of the national online magazine for college women. The New Jersey Press Foundation College Newspaper Contest consistently recognizes the Signal staff.

Courses

The Journalism and Professional Writing major is interdisciplinary, offering a broad range of courses in writing and other areas of study. Students have the flexibility to design programs appropriate to their goals and interests. Many students pursue second majors and minors in communication studies, interactive multimedia, English, history, international studies, psychology, or marketing. TCNJ also offers three related minors: journalism, professional writing, and broadcast and multimedia journalism.
